timeseries_qmc.sampling

class timeseries_qmc.sampling.ClusterUpdate(J: float, beta: float, coupling_list: list[list] | None = None, lattice: Lattice | None = None)

Bases: Sampler

Sampler of spin product states using Wolff’s cluster update for classical Ising models. For details of the algorithm, see U. Wolff, Collective monte carlo updating for spin systems, Phys. Rev. Lett. 62, 361 (1989).

Parameters:

  • J (float) – Coupling strength.

  • beta (float) – Inverse temperature.

  • coupling_list (list) – List of lists specifying the lattice bonds. Each list has two integers representing the sites of the bond. Either this parameter or lattice needs to be specified. Both parameters cannot be specified simultaneously.

  • lattice (tenpy.models.lattice.Lattice) – List of lists specifying the lattice bonds. Each list has two integers representing the sites of the bond. Either this parameter or coupling_list needs to be specified. Both parameters cannot be specified simultaneously.

propose_sample(old_sample: list | ndarray, rng: RandomState)

Inherited method. See Sampler.propose_sample().

class timeseries_qmc.sampling.KagomeClusterUpdate(J: float, beta: float, coupling_list: list[list] | None = None, lattice: Lattice | None = None)

Bases: Sampler

Sampler of spin product states using cluster update for antiferromagnatic classical Ising model on Kagome lattices. For details of the algorithm, see G. M. Zhang and C. Z. Yang, Cluster monte carlo dynamics for the antiferromagnetic ising model on a triangular lattice, Phys. Rev. B 50, 12546 (1994).

Note

The lattice specified by coupling_list or lattice parameters need to be a kagome lattice.

Parameters:

  • J (float) – Coupling strength.

  • beta (float) – Inverse temperature.

  • coupling_list (list) – List of lists specifying the lattice bonds. Each list has two integers representing the sites of the bond. Either this parameter or lattice needs to be specified. Both parameters cannot be specified simultaneously.

  • lattice (tenpy.models.lattice.Lattice) – List of lists specifying the lattice bonds. Each list has two integers representing the sites of the bond. Either this parameter or coupling_list needs to be specified. Both parameters cannot be specified simultaneously.

propose_sample(old_sample: list | ndarray, rng: RandomState)

Inherited method. See Sampler.propose_sample().

class timeseries_qmc.sampling.MarkovChain(boltzmann_weight_calculator: BoltzmannWeightCalculator, sampler: Sampler, inital_sample_bitstring: list | ndarray, seed: int)

Bases: object

Class representing a Markov chain of time-series quantum Monte Carlo samples.

Parameters:

  • boltzmann_weight_calculator (boltzmann.BoltzmannWeightCalculator) – Calculator of Boltzmann weights.

  • sampler (Sampler) – Sampler of quantum states.

  • initia_sample_bitstring (list or numpy.ndarray) – List/array of zeros and ones representing initial product state.

  • seed (int) – Seed for the random number generator.

property acceptance_rate: int

Acceptance ratio of proposed samples.

Note

This value is None when no sample has been generated so far.

property current_sample: ndarray

Bitstring of zeros and ones representing last generated product state.

property distinct_samples_count: int

Total number of unique samples generated sofar.

property distinct_samples_ratio: int

Ratio of distinct samples to the total number of generated samples.

generate_next_sample()

Adds a new sample to the chain.

property generated_samples_count: int

Total number of samples generated sofar.

get_boltzmann_weights()

Gets the Boltzmann weights for all samples of the chain.

Returns:

values – List of numbers represnting the Boltzmann weights. The elements are ordered by their generation time.

Return type:

list

get_local_energies()

Gets the local energies for all samples of the chain.

Returns:

values – List of numbers represnting the local energies. The elements are ordered by their generation time.

Return type:

list

get_local_energies_squared()

Gets the second moment of local energies for all samples of the chain.

Returns:

values – List of numbers represnting the second moment of local energies. The elements are ordered by their generation time.

Return type:

list

get_magnetziations_squared() → list

Calculates the squared magnetization for all samples of the chain.

Returns:

values – List of numbers represnting the squared magnetizations. The elements are ordered by their generation time.

Return type:

list

get_samples() → list

Gets a copy of all samples of the chain.

Returns:

samples – List of bitstrings of zeros and ones representing the generated product states. The elements are ordered by their generation time.

Return type:

list

load(file_path: str)

Load a chain of samples from file. It overwrites the content of the chain with the loaded one.

save(file_path: str)

Save a chain of samples to a file. It creates parent directories if necessary.

class timeseries_qmc.sampling.Sampler

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for sampling quantum states.

abstract propose_sample(old_sample_bitstring: list | ndarray, rng: RandomState)

Proposes a new random sample based on the old one.

Parameters:

  • old_sample_bitstring (list or numpy.ndarray) – List/array of zeros and ones representing old product state \(|\psi\rangle\).

  • rng (numpy.random.RandomState) – Random number generator.

Returns:

  • new_sample_bitstring (numpy.ndarray) – List/array of zeros and ones representing new product state \(\psi^\prime\).

  • proposal_ratio (float) – Ratio of proposal probabilities \(\frac{p(\psi^\prime \to \psi)}{p(\psi \to \psi^\prime )}\)

class timeseries_qmc.sampling.SingleFlip

Bases: Sampler

Sampler of spin product states using single spin flips.

propose_sample(old_sample: list | ndarray, rng: RandomState)

Inherited method. See Sampler.propose_sample().

timeseries_qmc.sampling.generate_chain(boltzmann_weight_calculator: BoltzmannWeightCalculator, sampler: Sampler, inital_sample_bitstring: list | ndarray, seed: int, num_samples: int, chain_file_path=None)

Generate a Markov chain with a specified number of samples.

If parameter chain_file_path is supplied, the chain is attempted to be loaded from the file and the sampling continues till the specified number of samples is reached. Also the chain is saved after each sample is generated.

Parameters:

  • boltzmann_weight_calculator (boltzmann.BoltzmannWeightCalculator) – Calculator of Boltzmann weights.

  • sampler (Sampler) – Sampler of quantum states.

  • initia_sample_bitstring (list or numpy.ndarray) – List/array of zeros and ones representing initial product state.

  • seed (int) – Seed for the random number generator.

  • num_samples (int) – Number of samples in the chain.

  • chain_file_path (str) – Path of the file used to store/retrieve the chain data. Value None can be used to avoid storing/retreiving data.

Returns:

chain – Markov chain with the specified number of samples.

Return type:

MarkovChain
